data.title: OMG! The Supreme Calzone
data.text: " Supreme Calzone" with Marinara dipping sauce was awesome.  If you like calzones this is the place to go. The crust was thin, flavorful and baked to perfection. The filling ratio of fresh veggies, meat and cheese was absolutely delicious. I will be a repeat customer. I look forward to trying the pizza my next visit.

data.title: Great local pizza
data.text: Good pizza with thinner crust, which we love.  The seasoning and sauce is very tasty.  It's much better than a chain restaurant and it's conveniently located downtown.  Would like to see more items added to the menu.  The owner and his wife are very friendly and give back to the community so we like to support their local business.

data.title: Best 'home made' pizza in town
data.text: A must visit - if you are in Springfield for a while. Family owned and always friendly restaurant. We've had their chicken pizza several times and always love it. Their garlic knots are delicious too!

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Nice place in an old building, wood fired oven pizza is good and the garlic knots are great. If you want wood fired it is the place in Springfield.

data.title: Good Food, Good Service, Fun Decor
data.text:
PROS:
* friendly service
* very cool atmosphere and decor
* reasonable prices
* tasty food made to order and cooked well
* serves beer
* huge menu with lots of specialty pizza choices

CONS:
* cramped ordering area
* not a ton of seating (only a con when it's busy)
* prompted to tip when paying, even with carry-out and before getting your food

FULL REVIEW:

While in Springfield visiting family, we were told by the family that we needed to eat at Bada Bing! while visiting the new brewery which just opened up.  So we did just that.

We walked a short distance from the brewery to this pizza shop, located downtown.  There appears to be a public parking lot adjacent to this place, so that's handy.

We were getting our food to go, so we walked up to the ordering counter.  It's a little cramped and narrow there, and I'd image that when it's busy, that gets to be a bit of an annoyance.

The young lady who took our order was very patient as we decided.  There were three of us ordering different foods and she made sure to enter everything just as we wanted.  We appreciated how courteous she was.

One thing I didn't like is payment.  When ready to pay with my card, the ordering tablet was turned towards me and a big question about how much I wanted to tip was displayed.  I felt put on the spot and awkward.  I mean, the nice young lady was standing right there and I was to determine if I wanted to tip, even before the food came.  I didn't like that.  Besides, it was a to-go order.  No place should ever ask you to tip prior to getting your food, that's how I feel.  Don't get me wrong, I have no issues tipping when it's warranted...but this felt weird.  It's on a big tablet and displayed for anyone around to see.  Plus, they have a tip jar right beside the register!

While waiting, we took in the cool decor of the pizza shop.  It's a long narrow building with some large photos of Springfield "back in the day."  The building has a very industrial look with some charm mixed in.  

The long bar seating area surrounding the kitchen has such a cool look to it.  Very unique.  

There appeared to be an outdoor seating area out back, but we did not go out there.

This place serves beer, which is fantastic.  

The menu is huge.  If you're here for a pizza, beware, choices are ample.  They feature tons of specialty pizzas which sounded fantastic.  Or, simply create your own.  Plus, there were other Italian favorites, subs, salads, etc.  Prices were reasonable.

Two of us ordered calzones and I ordered a sub.  I cannot have dairy, so my options were a little limited (yes, I know it's a pizza place), but I did have a nice choice of subs.  I had the barbecue chicken sub which was cubed grilled chicken smothered in BBQ sauce with lettuce.  The sub roll tasted very fresh (possibly baked there) and was toasted perfectly.

The others with their calzones seemed to enjoy.  They looked good, not burnt and filled with plenty of goodies.

Food was made in adequate time and cooked well.  It wasn't exceptional, but certainly nothing wrong with it.

data.title: Great Food - Nice kids!
data.text:
Get the Goombah - seriously, Joey "Bag of Donuts" and Little Nicky  Blue Shoes wouldn't lie to you.  Get the Goombah - no get two of them and we'll be by to pick it up , make it a large... oh and the garlic knots,  excellent, better than Mama used to make. 

They are open late - no rush.

data.title: Best pizza in town.
data.text:
This small, but very friendly place serves tasty pizza, wine, and soft drinks.  It always feels like a party atmosphere.
A variety of pizza toppings, yummy red sauce, and crispy crust make for a good meal any time

data.title: Average pizza at best
data.text: Location is useful to those working downtown but that's the best part of this place. I have gotten takeout pizza twice from them as I could not believe the first was so average with all the great ratings. But they do deserve the average rating from me. Soggy crust and not enough sauce and toppings make it average for pizza in Springfield. Was not cooked hot enough to brown the cheese twice and it is overpriced. All of which make it average here. Be sure to look for their coupons to make it reasonable.

data.title: Good Pizza and Great service!
data.text: Great Pizza place downtown, situated in a Cool historic building. Service was Awesome. Everyone there was very helpful and attentive. Our Pizza was really good too. Great selection of craft beers. The owners came to our table as we finished dinner to ask if we needed anything. Very nice couple.  Great for couples, friends or families.

data.title: Pizza time
data.text: Nice little place to have good pizza an beer. Good salads and sandwich options and selection of soft drinks.

data.title: Pizza and service was fantastic
data.text: We got two large pizzas which were really tasty and a very friendly staff. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys pizza.

data.title: Dinnet
data.text: Salad was really good. The pizza took a little while longer than expected to be brought out.The pizza was good. They are finally figuring it out, since they have moved to the downtown location. The gentleman at the counter has the best personality. His customer service skills are great. I hope they don't lose him.

data.title: Best pizza ever!!
data.text: My son and I went here for a quick dinner after a 3 hour drive through Indiana/ Ohio.  What a find!!  Great personalities of the owners and even better food!!  We had the garlic knots and a pizza with 1/2 grilled chicken, 1/2 pepperoni and bacon.  AWESOME!!  We both were floored with how good this was!  I so wish we lived closer and were not just traveling through....this would be a regular stop!!  Clean, organized, and delicious!!

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: Great pizza and awesome crust with the perfect balance of ingredients. Would go back in a heartbeat for sure.

data.title: Great Pizza and Caring Owner
data.text: Just wanted readers to know that beyond having great food, the owner is a humanitarian as well. I read in our local newspaper that he invited everyone in town who had no place to go at Thanksgiving to share the holiday with him and his family. That kind of attitude is rare and worthy of your support.

data.title: Yummy!!!
data.text: The best pizza around town. A crowd pleaser. The menu has a variety of fire stone baked goodies. Salads, bread sticks, subs and fountain drinks and dessert are some of the other items available.

data.title: No waiter service
data.text: The food was quite good and the prices reasonable - the garlic knots and the dessert version are wonderful.  I had one of the speciality pizzas as a calzone and it was done well.  There are lots of craft beers to choose from in a cooler, but there is no waiter service.  You order at the counter and they bring the food, but that's about it.

data.title: Delicious and Unique Pizzas
data.text: Walked to dinner from a nearby hotel and found this little whole in the wall.  Great customer service and amazing food. Enjoyed the variety of pizzas offered.

data.title: Delicious pizza!
data.text: I ate at Bada Big pizza and it was delicious. We shared a large cheese pizza garden salad and bread knots. Everything was fresh pizza and served hot as we're the bread knots. Friendly service. Reasonably priced.  We will return!

data.title: Pretty Good!
data.text: The folks at BadaBing are friendly and try to please - despite being from out of state, they were happy to honor the "all A" report card special when our daughter presented a cell phone pic of her recent report card!  And although they did not deliver the grinder we ordered as asked, they were quick to correct their mistake when it was brought to their attention, and it earned rave reviews from my dad. The individual gourmet pizza I ordered was light and tasty, with a crispy outer crust that had a soft, fresh center and was not overcooked.  The larger cheese pizza was not quite as good, with too much cheese making it heavy and a bit soggy. But on balance, this was good option for casual dining and I would definitely recommend it, as there are very few other downtown options.
